'''Warflying''' or '''warstorming''' is an activity consisting of using an airplane and a [[Wi-Fi]]-equipped computer, such as a [[laptop]] or a [[Personal digital assistant|PDA]], to detect [[Wi-Fi]] [[wireless network]]s. Warstorming shares similarities to [[Wardriving]] and [[Warwalking]] in all aspects except for the method of transport.
It originated in [[Western Australia]] with the [http://www.wafreenet.org WaFreeNet (WAFN)] group taking up a [[Grumman American AA-5|Grumman Tiger]] four-seater near [[Perth City]] in 2002, as documented on the weblog of [http://www.e3.com.au Jason Jordan]
Due to the nature of flying, it is much more difficult to attempt to access open networks while warflying.
